snippet: Officers at the scene of the explosion in East Harlem saw a 15-year-old’s face and hand poking out of the debris. Moments after saving the boy, the rescuers were forced to retreat as the fire intensified.
abstract: Police officers at scene of building explosion in East Harlem rescue 15-year-old Oscar Hernandez from wreckage, rare bit of joyful news to emerge from devastating incident; Hernandez's mother and sister were both found dead in rubble after his rescue.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Daniel Krieger, Mireya Navarro and Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officers at the scene of the explosion in East Harlem saw a 15-year-old’s face and hand poking out of the debris. Moments after saving the boy, the rescuers were forced to retreat as the fire intensified.

headline.main: Amid Rubble, a Bloody Face Spied in Time
headline.print_headline: Amid Rubble, a Bloody Face Spied in Time
